meanings.definition: The upper front part of a shoe or boot.
meanings.sent1: She admired the shiny vamp of her new boots.
meanings.sent2: The cobbler carefully stitched the vamp of the shoe.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy chewed on the vamp of the sneaker.
meanings.sent4: The vamp of the boot stood out like a polished shield.
meanings.sent5: Her dance shoes had a sparkling vamp that caught everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: A seductive woman who uses her charm to exploit men.
meanings.sent1: The mysterious vamp at the party captivated all the guests.
meanings.sent2: In the movie, the vamp lured the protagonist into her trap.
meanings.sent3: The vamp's flirtatious smile made everyone in the room blush.
meanings.sent4: She played the role of the vamp in the play with great allure.
meanings.sent5: The femme fatale was the ultimate vamp in the film noir classic.

meanings.definition: To repair or improve something in a makeshift or hasty way.
meanings.sent1: He had to vamp up the broken chair before the guests arrived.
meanings.sent2: In a rush, she managed to vamp together a costume for the party.
meanings.sent3: Trying to vamp a solution, he used duct tape to fix the leak.
meanings.sent4: She had to vamp her speech at the last minute due to technical issues.
meanings.sent5: The team had to vamp a plan to finish the project on time.
